intro: Clinopodium obovatum, commonly known as broad-leaf horehound, is a perennial herb native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to broadly ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its small, blue to purple flowers are clustered in whorls along the upper stem, and it is known for its medicinal properties. Clinopodium obovatum is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils.
